tool_description: Execute MySQL queries via this REST API
name: MySQL
title: MySQL

api_list.name: Execute MySQL Query
api_list.description:
Use this endpoint to execute any MySQL query. Note that this API is primarily intended to be used for simple, short running queries. So the query timeout is set to 30 seconds.

If you want to restrict inbound connections to your MySQL server, you can setup your firewall to only allow connections from the following ip addresses (Please note that in order for this API to functions in a stable manner, ALL of the below ip addresses need to be allowed to access your MySQL server):
20.31.218.98,20.31.218.136,20.31.218.137,20.126.166.34,20.126.166.41,20.103.91.43,20.126.166.42,20.126.166.47,20.126.167.230,51.124.129.98,51.124.132.74,20.86.208.78,20.86.209.120,20.86.209.155,20.86.210.18,20.86.210.247,20.86.211.71,20.86.211.159,20.86.211.166,20.86.213.119,20.86.213.149,20.86.214.123,20.101.184.116,20.101.186.248,20.101.187.107,20.101.187.108,20.101.187.172,20.101.187.177,20.101.190.225,20.23.49.78,20.105.232.11
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://mysql3.p.rapidapi.com/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mysql3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://mysql3.p.rapidapi.com/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "mysql3.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
